result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeffrey S. Schreiner was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manuf/Deliver Schedule I, II Narcotics, a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

miscConds.notes:
May not vote or serve on a jury until civil rights are restored.
No firearms or body armor.
Provide DNA sample; defendant to go to jail by 3:00 pm on 4-20-15 to give DNA sample
Pay DNA surcharge.

May not be in any establishment whose primary purpose is the sale of alcohol.
No prescriptions except for those approved by agent.
No contact with J.S. or his immediate family.

Provide truthful testimony in any further proceedings.
AODA assessment followed by treatment and aftercare.
Defendant must set up probation by 4:30 pm on 4-20-15.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jeffrey S. Schreiner

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jeffrey S. Schreiner in court with attorney Brad Hansen.  Kent R. Hoffmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
2:34PM
ADA spks on PSI corrections
Atty Hansen spks on corrections
ADA spks on sentencing
Atty Hansen spks on sentencing
Def addresses the court
Court imposes: Imposed and stayed: 5 years initial confinement, 5 years extended supervision. No days credit. Not eligible for CIP or SAP.
3 years probation with cond:
Pay costs+fees including $250 buy money+ $200 DNA surcharge
Provide truthful testimony in any further proceedings
May not be in any establishment whose primary purpose is the sale of alcohol.
No prescriptions except for those approved by agent.
No contact with J.S or his immediate family
Maintain full-time employment
AODA assessment followed by treatment and aftercare
May not vote, hold public office, or serve on a jury until civil rights are restored.
No firearms or body armor.
Provide DNA sample & surcharge. 
Def to go to jail by 3PM Mon 4-20-15 to give DNA sample
Def must set up probation by 4:30PM Mon 4-20-15
Appeal rights
